tech-stack-rules.description: Authoritative coding standards for Nezuko. Backend: Python 3.13+, AsyncIO, SQLAlchemy 2.0, Pydantic V2, PTB v22, Redis, Sentry, Structlog. Frontend: Next.js 16, React 19, TypeScript strict, TanStack Query, Zustand, Tailwind v4, Shadcn/UI. Use for: code review, refactoring, debugging, architecture decisions, library selection, async patterns, database patterns, type safety, error handling, testing, security, performance tuning, technical debt. Prevents forbidden anti-patterns. Essential for project best practices.

skill-developer.description: Comprehensive guide for Architecting and Managing Claude Code skills. Use when: 1) Defining triggers, enforcement policies, and hooks. 2) Debugging skill activation. 3) Structuring 'Progressive Disclosure' for large documentation. 4) Managing skill-rules.json. Covers the 500-line rule, frontmatter validation, and best practices for creating maintainable agentic skills.

skill-creator.description: Process guide for Scaffolding and Packaging skills. Distinct from skill-developer (which is about architecture), this skill focuses on the *mechanics* of: 1) Running init_skill.py scripts, 2) Creating 'references/' and 'assets/' folders, 3) Packaging .skill files for distribution. Use this when physically building the skill files.

telegram-bot-builder.description: Expert knowledge on Telegram Bot API (PTB, grammY, Telegraf). Capabilities: 1) Bot Architecture (Handlers, Middleware), 2) UX Patterns (Inline Keyboards, Menus), 3) Monetization Models (Payments, Subscriptions), 4) Anti-patterns to avoid (Blocking I/O, Spamming). Use when building or optimizing bot logic.

ui-ux-pro-max.description: Deep UI/UX Design Intelligence. Features 50+ styles, 97 color palettes, and strict rules for Accessibility/Interaction. Actions: 1) Generate Design Systems (Python script), 2) Audit UI (Contrast, Click targets), 3) Verify Stack-specific patterns (Tailwind v4, React 19). STRICTLY FORBIDS: Emojis as icons, low contrast, and layout shifts.
